summary: This document is a memorandum decision from the United States District Court regarding a case involving Jeffrey E. Epstein and Ivan S. Fisher. The court addresses the government's request to evict the defendants from a property and discusses the confidentiality of Fisher's tax return in relation to the case. The court ultimately rules against the government's proposed use of confidential information for purposes outside the current lawsuit.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is one of the defendants in the eviction case brought by the United States government regarding a property he leased.

persons.name: Ivan S. Fisher
persons.context: Fisher is the co-defendant in the eviction case and has sublet the property from Epstein.

persons.name: Mary Jo White
persons.context: White represents the United States in the case against Epstein and Fisher.

persons.name: Serene Nakano
persons.context: Nakano is assisting Mary Jo White in representing the United States in the case.

persons.name: G. Robert Gage, Jr.
persons.context: Gage represents Ivan S. Fisher in the eviction case.

persons.name: Ellen J. Casey
persons.context: Casey is also part of the legal team representing Ivan S. Fisher.

connections.description: Epstein leased the property to Fisher, who sublet it to others.
White is the supervising attorney for Nakano in the case against Epstein and Fisher.
Gage and Casey are both attorneys representing Ivan S. Fisher.

events.title: Court Memorandum Decision
events.description: The court issued a memorandum decision regarding the eviction case and the confidentiality of Fisher's tax return.

events.title: Conference on Protective Order
events.description: A conference was held where the court overruled Fisher's objection to the production of his tax return under certain conditions.

keyFacts: The United States government seeks to evict Epstein and Fisher from a property formerly used by the Iranian consulate.
Epstein sublet the property to Fisher without government consent, leading to the eviction action.
The court ruled against the government's request to use Fisher's tax return for purposes outside the current lawsuit.
Fisher objected to the government's proposed protective order regarding the confidentiality of his tax return.
The court emphasized the importance of confidentiality in civil litigation and the protection of tax information.
